220.question: How many people participated in their evaluation study of table-to-text models?

222.question: By how much more does PARENT correlate with human judgements in comparison to other text generation metrics?
222.response: {'Answer': 'PARENT-W correlates 0.174 more with human judgments compared to BLEU, 0.098 more compared to BLEU-T, 0.112 more compared to RG-F, and 0.156 more compared to PRT-C on WikiBio. On WebNLG, PARENT-W correlates 0.066 more with human judgments compared to METEOR, 0.065 more compared to ROUGE, 0.056 more compared to CIDEr, 0.034 more compared to BLEU, 0.031 more compared to BLEU-T, and 0.026 more compared to CIDEr-D.'}
222.answer: Best proposed metric has average correlation with human judgement of 0.913 and 0.846 compared to best compared metrics result of 0.758 and 0.829 on WikiBio and WebNLG challenge.

223.question: By how much more does PARENT correlate with human judgements in comparison to other text generation metrics?
223.response: {'Answer': 'PARENT correlates 0.08 more with human judgements in comparison to BLEU, 0.07 more compared to BLEU-T, 0.18 more compared to RG-F and 0.02 more compared to PARENT-C.'}
223.answer: Their average correlation tops the best other model by 0.155 on WikiBio.
